titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry Ashby Turner, Jr. Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Richard Szary and William Landis

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:57

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of Henry Ashby Turner's correspondence with other historians about the controversy surrounding David Abraham's book, The Collapse of the Weimar Republic . A later accession comprises two databases, one containing information concerning foreign workers in the Adam Opel AG plant in Rüsselsheim, Germany, during the World War II era, and the other containing evaluative records concerning documents and articles relating to General Motors' acquisition, ownership, management, loss of effective control, write-off, and reacquisition of Adam Opel AG during the period from 1929 through the early 1950s.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Henry Ashby Turner, Jr., 1995 and 2008.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Henry Ashby Turner, Jr. Papers (MS 1691). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Henry Ashby Turner, Jr., born in 1932, received his B.A. degree from Washington and Lee University in 1954, and his M.A. (1957) and Ph.D. (1960) from Princeton. He held the following positions at Yale University: instructor in history, 1958-1961; assistant professor, 1962-1964; associate professor, 1964-1970; professor, 1971-1989; Charles Seymour Professor of History, 1990-1991; and Bass Professor of History, 1991-. Turner was master of Davenport College from 1981-1991. He was a noted scholar of modern Europe, particularly Germany. Turner died on December 17, 2008, in New Haven, Connecticut.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of Henry Ashby Turner's correspondence with other historians about the controversy surrounding David Abraham's book, The Collapse of the Weimar Republic . A later accession comprises two databases, one containing information concerning foreign workers in the Adam Opel AG plant in Rüsselsheim, Germany, during the World War II era, and the other containing evaluative records concerning documents and articles relating to General Motors' acquisition, ownership, management, loss of effective control, write-off, and reacquisition of Adam Opel AG during the period from 1929 through the early 1950s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession comprises two databases, one containing information concerning foreign workers in the Adam Opel AG plant in Rüsselsheim, Germany during the World War II era, and the other containing evaluative records concerning documents and articles relating to General Motors' acquisition, ownership, management, loss of effective control, write-off, and reacquisition of Adam Opel AG during the period from 1929 through the early 1950s. These databases were created sometime betweeen 1998 and 2000 by a team of researchers directed by Professor Henry A. Turner of Yale University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also: General Motors Documents Relating to World War II Corporate Activities in Europe (MS 1799). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: Related Publication Note: The databases were created during the course of research that resulted in the following publication: Turner, Henry Ashby, Jr. General Motors and the Nazis: The Struggle for Control of Opel, Europe's Biggest Carmaker . New Haven: Yale University Press, 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This database contains information on foreign workers at the Adam Opel AG plan in Rüsselsheim, Germany, during the early 1930s through World War II. This information was extracted from Ostarbeiter (Eastern worker) savings books and personnel records maintained by Opel.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The computer files are unprocessed and are in a physical state that requires staff intervention before use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu. The staff intervention may take up to 10 business days.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This database contains evaluative information regarding significant documents and publications relating to General Motors' acquisition, ownership, management, loss of effective control, write-off, and reacquisition of Adam Opel AG from 1929 through the early 1950s.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The computer files are unprocessed and are in a physical state that requires staff intervention before use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu. The staff intervention may take up to 10 business days.
